title: How to Make Vegetable and Cheese Quiche

steps.headline: Chop the onion into bite-sized pieces.
Chop the bell peppers into bite-sized pieces.
Sauté the onions and peppers in the olive oil or butter.
Prepare the spinach.
steps.description: If you are using fresh spinach, sauté it until it wilts. If you are using frozen spinach, thaw it. Drain or squeeze out excess liquid.

steps.headline: Blind bake the crusts for 2-3 minutes.
Arrange the sautéed vegetables in the pie shells, then add the scallions and spinach.
Place the grated cheese on top of the vegetables.
Beat 8-9 eggs, or use egg replacements for a lighter mix.
steps.description: Add some milk to the mixture with dashes of salt, pepper, paprika and a little cayenne. After the crust is filled to the top with cheese, and vegetables, pour in the liquid mixture to the top.

steps.headline: Bake the quiches at 350F for 45 minutes or until done.
steps.description: The egg mixture should set up, so it is no longer liquid in the middle, and a knife inserted in the middle should come out clean.

steps.headline: Allow to cool for a few minutes, then slice and enjoy.

text: Chop the onion into bite-sized pieces.  Chop the bell peppers into bite-sized pieces. Remove the seeds and stem. Sauté the onions and peppers in the olive oil or butter. Drain off any excess liquid. Prepare the spinach. If you are using fresh spinach, sauté it until it wilts. If you are using frozen spinach, thaw it. Drain or squeeze out excess liquid. Slice the scallions thinly.  Blind bake the crusts for 2-3 minutes.  Grate the cheese.  Arrange the sautéed vegetables in the pie shells, then add the scallions and spinach.  Place the grated cheese on top of the vegetables.  Beat 8-9 eggs, or use egg replacements for a lighter mix. Add some milk to the mixture with dashes of salt, pepper, paprika and a little cayenne. After the crust is filled to the top with cheese, and vegetables, pour in the liquid mixture to the top. Bake the quiches at 350F for 45 minutes or until done. The egg mixture should set up, so it is no longer liquid in the middle, and a knife inserted in the middle should come out clean. Allow to cool for a few minutes, then slice and enjoy.
